subject: Happy Thanksgiving
event:
I had a great Thanksgiving yesterday with a great bunch of friends.  

The turkey was great and the company was greater.

Before and after the feast, we played tennis, golf, and bowling on the Wii that Parris got me.  Good thing too, since the NFL offered up three really lame-ass football games.

comments.article:
Piece of advice to the NFL Fan. Get Madden '09.

It's better than watching the game.
Franchise mode is the absolute best.
Ugh, I need no reminders of the seahawks inability to *anything* all season.  Having them play on a holiday is just cruel to us northwesterners

comments.upictitle: The Greatest Fucking Genius of All Time: villain
comments.article: seriously.  blah.
We had a lovely thanksgiving, too.  We picked up Rusty and brought him to our family dinners.  Miss you guys!

comments.upictitle: Some guy in a maze: animated black mage
comments.article: The detroit game was so bad, it even made the news up here.

Glad you had a good Thanksgiving!

One note about the Wiimote: beware swinging it around too forcefully. They've been known to slip out of your hand and rocket right into an expensive television screen. :P I know they recalled a bunch of the controls and improved the straps, as well as included a silicon jacket for improved grip (which you should definitely use), but even so ...

A game I've recently seen recommended for the Wii is Okami, with visuals inspired by Japanese watercolors and interesting gameplay that suits the Wiimote very well.
Okami rules, whether on the PS2 or on Wii.  It's absolutely beautiful!
Which of the wii games was your favorite?  Mine is Wii tennis by far. (probably because that's the one I'm best at, haha)

Hi!, i'm a lover of your books,before I continue writting, i have to say that, I'm spanish, so my english isn´t very well!. Congratulations for your books, there are the best that i have ever read, they're great!!! I like too much your form to tell the history,it is incredible, I think that you are the only person who can keep the atention of the person all teh time i more than 800 pages. Congratulations for your work! Have you ended the 5th novel of Song of Ice and Fire, in spain, it isn't , i'm waiting impatiently since i've finished the last novel.
I hope you've had a great Thanksgiving day!
Hugs from spain!!
I hope you have understand the most part of the text, i only now british english, so it is the best that can i do...
Continue writting!
comments.subject: Hello!

comments.article:
Your English is better than that of most Americans. : P


Happy Thanksgiving, George (and Parris).
comments.subject: Re: Hello!

comments.article: Happy Thanksgiving!
Hooray for the Wii! My friends got me one for my birthday; my mother disapproves, but I claim it increases my (non-existent) sporting skills.

i shall hafta take ye up on Wii Boxing, sir george. mine score marks the auspicious 33, give or take...

i'm the guy to beat around the daycare where i volunteer. where i saunter, hollow fright cringes whence my path sprang.
comments.subject: dare you bell the cat, contender

comments.article:
after reading in his Wiki page that Kurt Warner campaigned against a stem cell research ballot proposal in the last election, I decided I'm anti-Cardinals.

yeah rather dull day, though I admit I'm becoming a Tony Romo fanboi.

Cable's out so I can't say anything about the games, other than that Thanksgiving just wasn't the same without them.
Glad you had a great Thanksgiving!

Ah, the Wii. I hope -nay, pray- that your friends arent as competitive on that damn machine as mine are.

It's only matter of time before someone gets beaten silly with the Wiimote.

On that note,

Happy Thanksgiving!

Especially Wii boxing! I was fighting someone who kept edging forward with each punch while I stayed in one place. I made a big roundhouse and wham! punched her right in the back of the head. It was funny when she regained consciousness.

I may exaggerate slightly

comments.upictitle: J.A.C.K. Inc.  Super Secret Ninja Force: chiburi
comments.article: Happy Thanksgiving!
We enjoyed watching my family watch the game. My dad decided he wasn't going to root for the Lions anymore. Go Colts (apparently).

Lame-ass games??? As a Cowboys fan, I thoroughly enjoyed the throttling given to the sad Seattle Seahawks. Alliteration aside, a did feel a slight twinge of sadness over how completely inept the 'Hawks looked in Mike Holmgren's final season. Great coach turned lame duck. Oh Well... Bring on the Steelers!

Tell me about it. Who wants to sit down and watch games that are essentially over before they began? Why do they schedule those sorts of games for Thanksgiving?

Good to hear that your Turkey Day was good, though.

Do you think the Titans were expected to be 11-1? The Lions to be 0-10 or whatever they are?

Seattle was supposed to be fairly decent this year. All these games were supposed to be somewhat competitive, yet they ended the way they did, and that's football :D

Glad you enjoyed your thanksgiving Mr. Martin.

Oh do I agree with you soooo much about those games.

Congrats on the Wii!
My poor, poor Seahawks.

It seems only a short time ago they embarrassed the Giants. Holmgren's retirement should be just what they need.

Better luck with injuries next season.
Happy Thanksgiving.  I'm terrible at those games on the Wii, I can only do boxing.
comments.subject: Happy Thanksgiving

comments.article: Go Cowboys!
For thrills, you would have had to watch the college games. Nebraska beat Colorado with a 57-yard field goal. It was a thrilling sight--set a record.
Happy for your great holiday. Hope your Christmas is even better, sir. Happy holidays. :)

Being from Ireland, Thanksgiving went by without celebration. Or recognition of it's existence. Pity, too, because even if it's an American holiday, days off in late November is a wonderful prospect.

Enjoy your Wii, George! Perhaps you'll consider a PS3 when/if A Song of Ice and Fire comes out on Blu-Ray... ;)
Lame ass except for Hanson tying the record for field goals over 50 yards.

Happy Thanksgiving! About the games, the last time I've enjoyed Turducken bowls was when Emmitt and Barry were playing. Now the games are just background noise while napping off second lunches.

BTW, of all the consoles the Wii is the best!
